tweets.text:
Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M

@Feargal_Sharkey From what I‚Äôve read of the parish council minutes, the council are well aware of the Lugg‚Äôs SSSI status and the need for approval from the @EnvAgency Unlikely they acted without thinking they had approval. EA must clarify their role in this ASAP.

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@AnabaticW @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I'm very sorry for your M-in-L and all others like her. There are going to very many more such in the years to come but, however much goodwill such stories evoke, we need national policy solutions to the underlying problem. Incidentally - we've all paid taxes all our lives.

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@maggie_colledge @RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil But this is a major loss which could have been simply stopped by bringing in the police.

Jesus wept. Ecological Crime on a grand scale. I hope significant criminal charges are brought against those responsible and prosecuted aggressively. 

https://t.co/I3gxAyndrC

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Day 5 of reducing plastic at Christmas: make your own home-made treats! üç¨ Did you know that the UK produces 2,260,000 tonnes of plastic packaging waste every year? üò¨ @EnvAgency https://t.co/yi6V7gMXl2

entity.name: Christmas
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for Christmas for all years.

tweets.text: Recent research provides striking evidence of the benefits of making new clean water ponds for reversing catchment-wide declines in freshwater biodiversity. Ponds are a powerful vehicle for positive gains, with an impact out of all proportion to their size https://t.co/Ruwp8Vtuwg https://t.co/gMUuE52srm

@DanielMacKenzi6 @manereblog @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Reports say they requested the work cease 'last week', which includes the date it was first reported.

@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Tell that to my 81 year old mother in law that has paid taxes all her life and is continuously worried about being flooded again, living in a house that is worthless until the problem is sorted out! I think the farmer should be praised for his actions!

@MaddeverAndrew @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Seems that way. The police getting involved is pathetic, they shouldn't even be involving themselves in this sort of thing, but then i suppose its easier to police this than catching real criminals who wreck businesses and peoples livelihood
@EnvAgency @KendalSave

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX
Sometimes I despair of my fellow humans Understand the perpetrator is claiming @EnvAgency authorised the work Hope this is a lie https://t.co/rDE5BrRev7
@supercell_1996 @jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency To build on.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil This has all gone very quiet today Dave with some more information coming out locally seeming to point towards the EA sanctioning the work? Will you apologise to the landowner for the public outcry and abuse they received yesterday?

urls.title: Guest blog - How nature dies by Alistair Gammell - Mark Avery
urls.description: Alistair Gammell worked for RSPB for 40 years and was closely involved in the drafting of the Birds and Habitats Directives and for growing RSPB‚Äôs international work. He was RSPB‚Äôs first International Director and retired from RSPB in 2009. He then worked to successfully establish large scale fully protected marine reserves in the seas around the British Indian Ocean Territory and Pitcairn Island. He is a passionate nature conservationist and fly fisherman (alistairgammell@yahoo.co.uk) Oughton Head is a

tweets.text:
ICYMI: Guest Blog: How Nature Dies by Alistair Gammell https://t.co/TwtWsfjEUO

@EnvAgency @DefraGovUK https://t.co/q41j4997gB

@DanielMacKenzi6 @hertsessexbirds @Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They requested the work stop last week, when the 23rd occurred, according to the articles I have read. You can request details via the government 'freedom of information' portal.
@hertsessexbirds @Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Whats the point of a response which comes too late to stop the crime occurring?

@AnabaticW @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The key problem is that the EA is so badly underfunded and thus stretched - it's a central government problem. If you want things to change vote for the tax rises required to ensure funding.
@HarryMbike @MichaelFarrow2 @MaddeverAndrew @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Surely that depends if the village is immediately upstream or downstream from this work?

@manereblog @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil More of what, precisely? Failing to act u til the damage has been done. They could have prevented most of this destruction but decided not to do so.

@AnabaticW @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil No, no and no. But I understand rivers and I recognise completely inappropriate action by rogue landowners. And I can see an apologist for this behaviour a mile off.
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

urls.title: Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened
urls.description: Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô

tweets.text:
Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened https://t.co/zLdRlYgqQ0
Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô @SalmonTroutCons @NaturalEngland  @ForestryComm @EnvAgency https://t.co/hsQfSxvBTg

@piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Are you local? Do you know the area at all? Do you know where the next hold up is down stream?

@GeoffDa84684078 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil And your qualifications and experience in river management are? Especially those that pertain to riparian SSSIs.

@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I suspect the EA if taken to court could be found negligent for maintaining watercourses to prevent flooding! The parish council and all village residents voted for this to happen, each one was red in the face campaigning for the EA to do this work!
PICTURES: Extent of flooding in parts of #Kent revealed as river levels remain high after heavy rain https://t.co/KLfgk9DvC6 https://t.co/rZCxYMT2YZ

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Glad to hear your on the case I'd like to know
1. Who is the land owner?
2. Did they do this themselves or contractors?
3. If so who are the Contractors who carried out the work?
4. Will you he prosecuting both the Land Owner and Contractors as the Land Owner?

@AnabaticW @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil It is unlikely to discriminate between agricultural land and domestic properties.

@FrankieDev @piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil My mother in law has been flooded twice in 3 years this will alleviate the problem she will have and something should have been done by the EA when they were aware of the problem 7 years ago! But no one there can make a decision!

@piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Yes it shifts it to agricultural land where it can flood! Just is pure common sense which unfortunately in my experience the EA doesn‚Äôt have! Bunch of muppets

@MichaelFarrow2 @MaddeverAndrew @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency The vandalism here will make flooding more likely, wrecking businesses and destroying people's livelihoods. 

This isn't just illegal. It's actively dangerous.

@jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Looking at the way they have built up the river bank, presumably DIY flood prevention? Reaction to this record breaking flood on the Lugg in Kingsland area In Feb 2020.
https://t.co/97QehMdJvh
@FreyaLouisa @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Surely there would have had to be council approval for this? in which case they are also culpable

@AnabaticW @piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I live downstream, used to be on the edge of the floodplain until February but am now at even higher risk. I hope the EA can repair the damage and slow the flow along the entire length of the Lugg.

@woodgnomology If only the @EnvAgency had investigated earlier when activity was reported.. This makes my blood boil!! Who has had the ignorance and audacity to commit this environmental vandalism ... I just hope they will be prosecuted and heavily fined üò°
@Joey76840254 @gerrygowspint @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Yes. The Lugg contains the elusive, ancient relic, the Lamprey.

@Fleurfox @ecology_digest @sarahhenshall @Buzz_dont_tweet @NaturalEngland @incendiarypig @EnvAgency @CarolineLucas @KerryMP P. S. Just in case anyone takes this as a potential defence of the works (because, Twitter) - they are clearly excessive, inappropriate and needlessly destructive, not to mention illegal. Important to try and understand the full picture though. Enough conjecture from me I think.

tweets.text:
Someone needs to be jailed for this...

'Police and environment agency staff have moved in to stop further damage being done to the protected River Lugg, after what a witness described as one of the most egregious acts of ecological vandalism in 25 years.'
https://t.co/waHAREayoo
@gerrygowspint @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Is it a SSSI?
@EnvAgency Will you be restoring the criminal damage on the River Lugg?
@jonnynott @DavidJCrook @LaxBowel @RobGMacfarlane @mildthing99 @EnvAgency If so, then this is what it looked like in 2016 according to streetview https://t.co/v0mHkZYUCG

@EnvAgency Could probably do with a few here. Make sure the vandal pays

https://t.co/LluVynnc8u

@BluesomeH @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Flooding from River Lugg has caused major damage.
Personally the whole stretch needs dredging to prevent further flooding in Herefordshire.
#r4today 

https://t.co/KiXQTJlvxo

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won‚Äôt take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Now a prosecution needs to follow _and a proper, meaningful one - not some weedly fine or slap on the wrist. This is intentional, wilful, murderous, destruction and the penalty should reflect that. I am so sick of some landowners feeling they are above the law.
@AnabaticW @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil All this does is shift the point of flood!
@JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Come see what HS2 are trying to do to historical Stoneleigh Abbey Grounds https://t.co/sJ2vo26VbU

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

Expecting to hear a lot more from @EnvAgency about this bit. A lot more. Seems like most of the damage to the Lugg could have been prevented if EA had Actually. Done. Anything. when the initial report was made, rather than 8 days later.

https://t.co/TFpElReUQZ https://t.co/C90bL64rRM
@Underhillwood @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency @TonyJuniper What a massive surprise. Don‚Äôt hold your breath.
@AdamWelz @RobGMacfarlane @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency ah. John Price https://t.co/AhkRgmzt3k
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil There MUST be a prosecution for this disgraceful desecration of this beautiful #SSSI
